full_summary:
# Open Construction Source List for CFB Borden

### Government Tender Announcement

Defence Construction Canada (DCC) is inviting contractors and suppliers to apply to be placed on an Open Construction Source List (OCSL) for commercial, residential, industrial, institutional, and civil work required by the Department of National Defence at CFB Borden and its satellite sites in Meaford, Owen Sound, and Barrie for Fiscal Year(s) 2023-2024 (April 1, 2023 to March 31, 2024), 2024-2025 (April 1, 2024 to March 31, 2025), and 2025-2026 (April 1, 2025 to March 31, 2026).

### Key Highlights

*   Contractors and suppliers may request to be placed on the OCSL at any time, however, DCC requests that interested parties submit their request as soon as possible, preferably by January 23, 2023.
*   The OCSL will be used to tender construction services with an estimated value of $10 million and below.
*   DCC will invite all contractors and suppliers on the OCSL to bid on opportunities as they arise.

### Important Considerations

*   Contractors and suppliers who apply to be placed on the OCSL must submit a request through this MERX posting and indicate their preferred official language (English or French).
*   The language selected by the applicant for this OCSL will be the only language used for the tender documents, contract documents, and communication for all future tenders and during the execution of any resulting contract.
*   DCC reserves the right to continue using existing source lists, establish other source lists, and require additional pre-qualification requirements for specific tenders.
*   Contracts awarded by DCC may include measurable performance standards and requirements.

### Security Requirements

*   Tenders and contracts under this OCSL may contain organization and personnel security requirements.
*   Contractors may be required to actively hold all required security clearance(s) at the time of closing.

### How to Apply

*   Contractors and suppliers must submit a request through this MERX posting and indicate their preferred official language (English or French).
*   Interested parties can contact Jacob Lachapelle at [Jacob.Lachapelle@dcc-cdc.gc.ca](mailto:Jacob.Lachapelle@dcc-cdc.gc.ca) for more information.

### Links

*   Bidding and documents are available
